item.title: Road closure passed expiry date of permit, 30th August
item.description:
Thames water has carried out works which started on Friday 22nd August which was due to finish on 28th August. Permit number on screenshot above which has now been removed as of 29/8/25. People are riding their motorcycles on the pavement to go around the road closure impacting pedestrians lives. As of today, 30/8/25 the road is still closed. If the permit has expired, then the current closure is not approved. This is causing major disruption to surrounding roads.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 134, Cricklewood Lane, Golders Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No street cleaning, 30th August
item.description:
No street cleaning on durning road yet again. Please don’t file for sending someone round with 7 days that is just next weeks round. If they don’t turn up on Fridaythey should come on Monday and sort things out. Thank you.

item.title: Flags attached illegally to lamp posts on Park View Road, 30th August
item.description:
Five Union Jack flags have recently been illegally attached to lamp posts on the main road. These have the potential to incite racial tensions given recent social media campaigns associating the flag with anti-immigration sentiments.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park View Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of dumped items on Chancel Street, 30th August
item.description:
Mattresses, old furniture, rubbish and other dumped goods/waste is piling up on Chancel Street around the metal street furniture beside the Council estate car park. As reported before, this area needs regular checks by the Council as it is always used for fly tipping.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chancel Street, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hartland road nw6, 30th August
item.description:
Some parts of Hartland are so covered with leaves that it’s hard to tell where the pavement ends and where the road begins. I’m trying again here to ask for Veolia to be sent to do some basic street sweeping.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hartland Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees overreaching onto private land, 30th August
item.description:
We live at number 33 Tweedy Road and there is a tree that hugely overhangs our driveway and private parking, causing a persistent nuisance - dropping leaves and small branches onto our car. We’d like the tree cut back onto public land so it no longer reaches beyond the boundary.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tweedy Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Congestion, 30th August
item.description:
Something needs to be done urgently re the parking on both sides of the road along Hayes Lane due to Bromley football club using the road as an overfill for their car park ! It’s causes chaos everytime there is an event at the club they should not be allowed to let their patrons park along this road , cars are parking both sides of the road with little room for moving vehicles to pass, why are they being allowed to get away with this as when Hayes boot fair caused this chaos further along the road their patrons were made to park elsewhere and parking restrictions were put in place so why are Bromley fc patrons being allowed to do this ?! Why are there no parking restrictions for Bromley fc ???? Are they paying you at Bromley council ? Anyone else would not be allowed to get away with this and if Bromley fc cannot provide adequate parking for their patrons then they should cut down on the events and only admit those that can park in their car park as I don’t see why road users and residents have to continuously put up with this on a daily/weekly basis !!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, Hayes Lane, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet
